item.title: My Newsbeuter config file
item.description:
And here's my config file that I use with Newsbeuter.

article-sort-order  date asc
auto-reload         yes
reload-time         60
show-read-feeds     no
show-read-articles  no
mark-as-read-on-hover   no
bookmark-cmd        "~/Development/bookmark"
bookmark-autopilot  no
save-path           "~/Documents/Research"
item.dc:creator: mr_rcollins

item.title: Using RSS like it's 1990
item.description: I'm a big console fan, preferring to do as much work as possible from the command line. So it shouldn't be surprised that I also use RSS even as others have abandoned it for things like Twitter. I prefer to supplement my news feeds with Twitter and not replace it …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: Google Reader shuts off tomorrow, use Google Takeout and Reader is Dead to backup
item.description: Tomorrow Google Reader shuts off, have you grabbed your data? The easiest way to backup your subscriptions from Google Reader is to use Google Takeout. This will give you a .zip file with a lot of data, including a subscriptions.xml which you can import into any RSS reader that …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

A couple of months ago I decided to expand my use of Twitter, and began following more and more people in the education community. This was awesome, until I realized I could not keep up with the barrage of data …

item.title: Language arts teachers, take note, experience Bram Stoker's Dracula in real time
item.description:
Dracula

Experience Bram Stoker's Dracula in a new way -- in real time. Dracula is an epistolary novel (a novel written as a series of letters or diary entries,) and this blog will publish each diary entry on the day that it was written by the narrator so that the audience …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins
